bibl.author: Richard W. Colles
bibl.title: Richard W. Colles to Walt Whitman, 26 October 1889
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839â€“1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

body.p: Will you afford me the pleasure of possessing your "November Boughs"? I will remit you when I learn the price, of which I am ignorant at present. Professor Dowden told me of your having published a special ed of "L of G" & showed it me. You have already kindly signed "R.W. Colles from Walt Whitman" in your books for me may I ask a like favor for "N.B." Owing to severe illness have not yet been able to deliver the public lecture I intended to do. My heart has been very bad for months. I am better and hope to ful promise as well as realize a long entertained. If you will be good enough to forward me a photograph I shall deem it a very great favor & will include same in remittance.

postscript.p: I have subscribed for Sloane Kennedy's Book.
